definition: accent
cavity of body/barrel (e.g. engine cylinder)/compartment/tune/accent of speech
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: I exclaimed in a rather triumphant tone.
sentences.chinese: 我叫着，简直是一种胜利的腔调。

sentences.english: Now, however, it’s changing its tune.
sentences.chinese: 然而，如今这个国家却改变了腔调。

sentences.english: In this tone of contempt, or sarcasm, it’s weird.
sentences.chinese: 他那个腔调又是轻蔑又是嘲讽，真是奇怪。

sentences.english: Accent is the soul of language; it gives to it both feeling and truth. ---- J. J. Rousseau .
sentences.chinese: 腔调是语言的灵魂，它传递着感情和真理。

sentences.english: He has an incisive manner of speaking, happily free from umms and ers.
sentences.chinese: 他说话干脆利落，完全没有哼哼哈哈的腔调。

sentences.english: Parry crossed his arms and adopted a worldly, man-to-man tone.
sentences.chinese: 帕里抱起胳膊，腔调变得坦率而世故起来。

sentences.english: What is really depressing is the tone of our debate.
sentences.chinese: 真正令人不安的是我们争论的腔调。

sentences.english: Create it by matching their tone and talking speed.
sentences.chinese: 以他们的腔调和语速来谈论就能那样。

sentences.english: Li Yea. I'm a smart girl that speaks with a smart accent.
sentences.chinese: 是啊，我是个机灵的姑娘，说话带有时髦的腔调。

sentences.english: Melancholy is thus the most legitimate of all poetic tones.
sentences.chinese: 因此哀伤成了所有诗歌腔调的最合理的。
他说话的腔调使我厌烦。

sentences.english: Cou the mainland people to be doing other people's accent.
sentences.chinese: 但大陆人去凑人家的腔调干嘛呢。

sentences.english: If you change your tone a little, maybe you can say "Here" for me.
sentences.chinese: 如果你稍微地改变腔调，也许可以替我喊到。

sentences.english: Sergeant Parrott normally spoke with an upper- crust accent.
sentences.chinese: 帕罗特军士说话通常带着上流社会的腔调。

sentences.english: Vingo's critics had begun to change their note.
sentences.chinese: 评论文戈的人已经开始改变腔调了。

sentences.english: From year to year, Jeanne’s tone with the old woman became sharper.
sentences.chinese: 年复一年，珍妮对老太太说话的腔调变得愈加尖锐了。

definition: intonation/tone of voice/CL:個|个[ge4]
voice/accent
oral speech sounds (linguistics)
pitch of voice (high or low)/pitch (of a musical note)/tone
tone/note/a tone (on a Chinese syllable)/CL:個|个[ge4]
(of singing or speaking) very articulate pronunciation and vocalizing
see 頓挫抑揚|顿挫抑扬[dun4 cuo4 yi4 yang2]
voice
tone of voice/timbre
strange accent/odd manner of speaking or singing
nasal sound
Mandarin (common language)/Putonghua (common speech of the Chinese language)/ordinary speech
tone of voice/connotation in intonation/accent (regional etc)/snout/muzzle/lips/protruding portion of an animal's face
Beijing dialect
tone/manner of speaking/mood/CL:個|个[ge4]
tune/melody/tuning/cadence/intonation/(speech) tone
the first Chinese dialect dictionary, edited by Yang Xiong 揚雄|扬雄[Yang2 Xiong2] in 1st century, containing over 9000 characters
topolect/dialect
